alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 1:33AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, northwestern Dubuque and northeastern Delaware Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 132 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greeley, or 11 miles northeast of Manchester, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Asbury, Dyersville, Epworth, East Dubuque, Peosta, Earlville, New Vienna, Colesburg, Holy Cross, Greeley, Luxemburg, Rickardsville, Sherrill, Delaware, Centralia, Sageville, Balltown, Bankston and Durango. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
